00061 #ifndef INCepicsTypesh
00062 #define INCepicsTypesh 1
00063 
00064 #include <shareLib.h>
00065 
00066 #ifndef stringOf
00067 #       ifdef __STDC__
00068 #               define stringOf(TOKEN) #TOKEN
00069 #       else
00070 #               define stringOf(TOKEN) "TOKEN"
00071 #       endif
00072 #endif
00073 
00074 typedef enum {
00075    epicsFalse = 0,
00076    epicsTrue = 1
00077 } epicsBoolean;
00078 
00079 /*
00080  * Architecture Independent Data Types
00081  * (so far this is sufficient for all archs we have ported to)
00082  */
00083 typedef char epicsInt8;
00084 typedef unsigned char epicsUInt8;
00085 typedef short epicsInt16;
00086 typedef unsigned short epicsUInt16;
00087 typedef epicsUInt16 epicsEnum16;
00088 typedef int epicsInt32;
00089 typedef unsigned epicsUInt32;
00090 typedef float epicsFloat32;
00091 typedef double epicsFloat64;
00092 typedef unsigned long epicsIndex;
00093 typedef epicsInt32 epicsStatus;
00094 
00095 typedef struct {
00096    unsigned length;
00097    char *pString;
00098 } epicsString;
00099 
00100 /*
00101  * !! Dont use this - it may vanish in the future !!
00102  *
00103  * Provided only for backwards compatibility with
00104  * db_access.h 
00105  *
00106  */
00107 #define MAX_STRING_SIZE 40
00108 typedef char epicsOldString[MAX_STRING_SIZE];
00109 
00110 /*
00111  * union of all types
00112  *
00113  * Strings included here as pointers only so that we support
00114  * large string types.
00115  *
00116  * Arrays included here as pointers because large arrays will 
00117  * not fit in this union.
00118  */
00119 typedef union epics_any {
00120    epicsInt8 int8;
00121    epicsUInt8 uInt8;
00122    epicsInt16 int16;
00123    epicsUInt16 uInt16;
00124    epicsEnum16 enum16;
00125    epicsInt32 int32;
00126    epicsUInt32 uInt32;
00127    epicsFloat32 float32;
00128    epicsFloat64 float64;
00129    epicsString string;
00130 } epicsAny;
00131 
00132 /*
00133  * Corresponding Type Codes
00134  * (this enum must start at zero)
00135  *
00136  * !! Update epicsTypeToDBR_XXXX[] and DBR_XXXXToEpicsType
00137  *      in db_access.h if you edit this enum !!
00138  */
00139 typedef enum {
00140    epicsInt8T,
00141    epicsUInt8T,
00142    epicsInt16T,
00143    epicsUInt16T,
00144    epicsEnum16T,
00145    epicsInt32T,
00146    epicsUInt32T,
00147    epicsFloat32T,
00148    epicsFloat64T,
00149    epicsStringT,
00150    epicsOldStringT
00151 } epicsType;
00152 #define firstEpicsType epicsInt8T
00153 #define lastEpicsType epicsOldStringT
00154 #define validEpicsType(x)       ((x>=firstEpicsType) && (x<=lastEpicsType))
00155 #define invalidEpicsType(x)     ((x<firstEpicsType) || (x>lastEpicsType))
00156 
00157 
00158 /*
00159  * The enumeration "epicsType" is an index to this array
00160  * of type name strings.
00161  */
00162 #ifdef epicsTypesGLOBAL
00163 epicsShareDef READONLY char *epicsTypeNames[lastEpicsType + 1] = {
00164    "epicsInt8",
00165    "epicsUInt8",
00166    "epicsInt16",
00167    "epicsUInt16",
00168    "epicsEnum16",
00169    "epicsInt32",
00170    "epicsUInt32",
00171    "epicsFloat32",
00172    "epicsFloat64",
00173    "epicsString",
00174    "epicsOldString",
00175 };
00176 #else                           /* epicsTypesGLOBAL */
00177 epicsShareExtern READONLY char *epicsTypeNames[lastEpicsType + 1];
00178 #endif                          /* epicsTypesGLOBAL */
00179

00181  * The enumeration "epicsType" is an index to this array
00182  * of type code name strings.
00183  */
00184 #ifdef epicsTypesGLOBAL

00186    "epicsInt8T",
00187    "epicsUInt8T",
00188    "epicsInt16T",
00189    "epicsUInt16T",
00190    "epicsEnum16T",
00191    "epicsInt32T",
00192    "epicsUInt32T",
00193    "epicsFloat32T",
00194    "epicsFloat64T",
00195    "epicsStringT",
00196    "epicsOldStringT",
00197 };
00198 #else                           /* epicsTypesGLOBAL */
00199 epicsShareExtern READONLY char *epicsTypeCodeNames[lastEpicsType + 1];
00200 #endif                          /* epicsTypesGLOBAL */
00201 
00202 #ifdef epicsTypesGLOBAL
00203 epicsShareDef READONLY unsigned epicsTypeSizes[lastEpicsType + 1] = {
00204    sizeof(epicsInt8),
00205    sizeof(epicsUInt8),
00206    sizeof(epicsInt16),
00207    sizeof(epicsUInt16),
00208    sizeof(epicsEnum16),
00209    sizeof(epicsInt32),

00213    sizeof(epicsString),
00214    sizeof(epicsOldString),
00215 };
00216 #else                           /* epicsTypesGLOBAL */
00217 epicsShareExtern READONLY unsigned epicsTypeSizes[lastEpicsType + 1];
00218 #endif                          /* epicsTypesGLOBAL */

00220 /*
00221  * The enumeration "epicsType" is an index to this array
00222  * of type class identifiers.
00223  */
00224 typedef enum {
00225    epicsIntC,
00226    epicsUIntC,
00227    epicsEnumC,
00228    epicsFloatC,
00229    epicsStringC,
00230    epicsOldStringC
00231 } epicsTypeClass;
00232 #ifdef epicsTypesGLOBAL
00233 epicsShareDef READONLY epicsTypeClass epicsTypeClasses[lastEpicsType + 1] = {
00234    epicsIntC,
00235    epicsUIntC,
00236    epicsIntC,
00237    epicsUIntC,
00238    epicsEnumC,
00239    epicsIntC,
00240    epicsUIntC,
00241    epicsFloatC,
00242    epicsFloatC,
00243    epicsStringC,
00244    epicsOldStringC
00245 };
00246 #else                           /* epicsTypesGLOBAL */
00247 epicsShareExtern READONLY epicsTypeClass epicsTypeClasses[lastEpicsType + 1];
00248 #endif                          /* epicsTypesGLOBAL */

00251 #ifdef epicsTypesGLOBAL
00252 epicsShareDef READONLY char *epicsTypeAnyFieldName[lastEpicsType + 1] = {
00253    "int8",
00254    "uInt8",
00255    "int16",
00256    "uInt16",
00257    "enum16",
00258    "int32",

00262    "string",
